definition: to put one's hands behind one's head, fingers interlaced/to hold one's head in one's hands (in dismay, fright etc)/to cover one's head with one's hands (for protection)
to hold/to carry (in one's arms)/to hug/to embrace/to surround/to cherish
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously/also written 抱頭鼠竄|抱头鼠窜

sentences.english: But that night she sat on the top of the stairs with her head on her crossed arms and cried.
sentences.chinese: 可是那个晚上，她坐在楼梯口上抱头痛哭。

sentences.english: What shapeless lump is that, bent, crouch'd there on the sand?
sentences.chinese: 那在沙上弯着腰，抱头跌坐的一大堆是什么？

sentences.english: Two idiots did not have a lot of capacity for liquor crying at the row finally.
sentences.chinese: 没有酒量的两个傻瓜，最后在巷口抱头痛哭。

sentences.english: A quarrel only, with two people cry on each other's shoulder ended a noon.
sentences.chinese: 唯一的一次吵架，以两个人抱头痛哭一中午而告终。

sentences.english: Taking advantage of the enemy's wrong strategic move, we sent them fleeing in disorder.
sentences.chinese: 我们利用了敌军的错误战略部署把他们打得抱头鼠窜。

sentences.english: Seeing that the enemy were many, they ran away.
sentences.chinese: 看到敌人人多势众，他们抱头鼠窜了。

sentences.english: My sister and I held each other with our heads on each other's shoulders sobbing out of control.
sentences.chinese: 我和姐姐抱头痛哭，泪水打湿了彼此的肩膀。

sentences.english: Arrived another place, is again frighten by light flee ignominiously.
sentences.chinese: 到了另一处，又被灯光吓得抱头鼠窜。

sentences.english: I hold my head in my hands as I read his article.
sentences.chinese: 在读这篇文章的时候，我以手抱头。

sentences.english: They both cried on each other's shoulder at capital airport.
sentences.chinese: 在首都机场，两个人抱头痛哭。

sentences.english: When I arrived home, Peggotty met me at the door, and we cried miserably in each other' s arms.
sentences.chinese: 我到家时，辟果提在门口迎我，我们俩33抱头痛哭。

sentences.english: The defeated soldiers, throwing away their helmets and armour 5, flee for their lives.
sentences.chinese: 被打败的士兵丢盔弃甲，抱头逃命。

definition: to scamper off/to scurry off like a frightened rat
to beat one's chest
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
to huddle together/to curl up
to bawl/to cry/to wail/to howl/also written 號哭|号哭[hao2 ku1]
to weep disconsolately/to cry on each other's shoulder
to fall down
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to cry bitterly
to howl in grief/anguished wailing/same as 哀号
to cry piteously/anguished wailing/same as 哀嚎
to wail/to bawl (idiom)
to grimace (in pain)/to show one's teeth/to bare one's fangs
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
sound of crying
rolling and crawling/trying frantically to escape (idiom)
